As a legal counselor, I would advise you to consider the legal requirements and potential risks associated with building and selling electric motorbikes. Here are some specific things to consider:

1. Research local laws and regulations: Find out what legal requirements you need to follow when building and selling electric motorbikes in your area. This may include obtaining necessary licenses and permits, and complying with safety and environmental regulations.
2. Protect your intellectual property: If you have developed any unique designs or technologies for your electric motorbikes, consider applying for patents or trademarks to protect your intellectual property.
3. Review contracts and agreements: Carefully review any contracts or agreements you enter into, including those with suppliers, contractors, and customers. Make sure you understand your rights and responsibilities and seek legal advice if necessary.
4. Insure your business: Consider purchasing insurance to protect your business against potential risks, such as accidents or legal liabilities.
5. Comply with consumer protection laws: Follow all relevant consumer protection laws, including those related to advertising, sales, and warranties, to avoid legal problems and maintain a positive reputation.

By following these legal guidelines, you can minimize your legal risks and operate your business in a responsible and compliant manner.
